snippet: RAINONE--Nanette, age 73, died May 23, 2016. A fierce fighter against sexism, racism, war, intolerance, and, most recently, cancer, she was a dedicated daughter, mother, wife, friend, and artist. She pioneered on-air consciousness-raising at WBAI radio, created the Brooklyn Bridge Centennial, founded the Celebrate Brooklyn concert series, the Rotunda Gallery and the nonprofit arts and media organization BRIC, and took on ceramic sculpture with energy and passion. She was predeceased by her husband Harvey Schultz and is survived by her beloved son Bruno, stepsons Jason, Matthew, and Daniel, granddaughter Maxine, step-grandchildren Jack, Daniel and Evangeline, brother Martin, nephews Rocky and Shaun, and many loving family members, colleagues and friends. Services will be at Plaza Jewish Community Chapel, Amsterdam Ave. and W. 91st St., on Tuesday May 31 at 3pm. In lieu of flowers, please contribute to Planned Parenthood, BRIC, Greenwich House Pottery, or the Women's Studio Workshop in Rosendale, NY. 1/3
lead_paragraph: RAINONE--Nanette, age 73, died May 23, 2016. A fierce fighter against sexism, racism, war, intolerance, and, most recently, cancer, she was a dedicated daughter, mother, wife, friend, and artist. She pioneered on-air consciousness-raising at WBAI radio, created the Brooklyn Bridge Centennial, founded the Celebrate Brooklyn concert series, the Rotunda Gallery and the nonprofit arts and media organization BRIC, and took on ceramic sculpture with energy and passion. She was predeceased by her husband Harvey Schultz and is survived by her beloved son Bruno, stepsons Jason, Matthew, and Daniel, granddaughter Maxine, step-grandchildren Jack, Daniel and Evangeline, brother Martin, nephews Rocky and Shaun, and many loving family members, colleagues and friends. Services will be at Plaza Jewish Community Chapel, Amsterdam Ave. and W. 91st St., on Tuesday May 31 at 3pm. In lieu of flowers, please contribute to Planned Parenthood, BRIC, Greenwich House Pottery, or the Women's Studio Workshop in Rosendale, NY. 1/3
